intro: Satureja coreana, commonly known as Korean thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features small, pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are fragrant and have been used in traditional Korean medicine for their purported health benefits. Satureja coreana thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
